title: Adnormal Conversation Starters
text:
Find the survey at adnormal questions survey

Bayesian shrinkageFrequentist factor effects



bayes resultscodeIn-depth parameters














bayes_lm <- brms::brm(
  rating ~ q,  # Both fixed and random effects
  data = survey_tidy,
  prior = c(
    prior(normal(3.5, .5), class = Intercept),
    prior(normal(0, 0.2), class = b),  # Small random effect
    prior(exponential(1), class = sigma)
  ),
  chains = 4, iter = 2000, cores = 4,
  backend = "cmdstanr", silent = 2,
  file = "lm.1"
)









































Call:
lm(formula = rating ~ q, data = survey_tidy)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-2.91667 -0.75000  0.08333  1.00000  2.25000 

Coefficients:

qAI_morals          -6.667e-01  4.852e-01  -1.374   0.1712

qKorean_bias         5.000e-01  4.852e-01   1.031   0.3042

qNurture_vs_nature  -9.167e-01  4.852e-01  -1.889   0.0605 .

title: Adnormal Conversation Starters
text:
Find the survey at adnormal questions survey

Bayesian shrinkageFrequentist factor effects



bayes resultscode














bayes_ordinal_hierarchical <- brms::brm(
  rating ~ 1 + (1 | q),  
  data = survey_tidy,
  family = cumulative(link = "logit"),
  prior = c(
    # Global intercepts (cutpoints) 
    prior(normal(0, 1.5), class = Intercept),
    
    # Hierarchical variance - how much factor levels vary from grand mean
    prior(exponential(1), class = sd, group = q)
  ),
  chains = 4, iter = 2000, cores = 4,
  backend = "cmdstanr", silent = 2,
  file = "fits/ordinal_hierarchical"
)









Call:
lm(formula = rating ~ q, data = survey_tidy)

Residuals:
